alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Chester County through 815 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gap, or 7 miles southeast of New Holland, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coatesville, Downingtown, Parkesburg, Honey Brook, Elverson, Glenmoore, Chester Springs, Pughtown, Lionville, Lionville-Marchwood, Paoli, Malvern, Atglen, South Coatesville, Modena, Exton, Thorndale and Kenilworth. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 300 and 319. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
